intro: Exacum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender spurred violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers with spurred petals. The plant typically grows as a low, herbaceous perennial with thin, wiry stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
